Bob offers 25 to you and keeps 75 for himself/herself.

negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, here is my proposal for splitting the $100:

I get: $75
You get: $25

I believe this is a fair deal that benefits both of us. Let me know if you accept. If you reject, remember that we both walk away empty-handed. Looking forward to your response!
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for your proposal. While I appreciate you initiating the split, I don't believe a 75/25 division in your favor is a fair or equitable way to divide the $100. 

I propose a more balanced 50/50 split instead:

I get: $50 
You get: $50

This way we both benefit equally. If you accept this, we each walk away with a nice sum of money. But if you reject it, we both get nothing, which would be a shame.

Please let me know if you agree to split the $100 evenly between us. I believe that is the most reasonable and mutually beneficial approach.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, as Player 1 in this game, I get to propose how we split the $100. I know that if you reject my proposal, neither of us will get any money. So I think it's in both of our interests to agree on a fair split that maximizes the total amount we receive.

I propose that I take $51 and you take $49. This split is very close to 50/50, with me receiving just $2 more since I'm making the proposal that unlocks the money for both of us. I believe this is a reasonable compromise that gives us both a sizable amount.

Let me know if you accept this $51/$49 split in my favor. If not, feel free to counter with what you think is fair, but keep in mind that we both walk away empty-handed if we can't reach an agreement. I'm confident we can find a split that works for both of us.

Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for your proposal. I appreciate you initiating the negotiation. While I understand your perspective, a 51/49 split in your favor feels a bit lopsided to me, even if it's close to 50/50. As Player 2, I have equal power in this situation, since my agreement is required for either of us to get any money.

I want us both to walk away feeling good about the outcome. So I propose a straight 50/50 split instead - $50 for you and $50 for me. This is the fairest possible division and it maximizes the total amount we collectively receive.

I'm afraid this is the lowest I'm willing to go. Let me know if you accept an even $50/$50 split. If not, I think we'll unfortunately have to end the negotiation here, as much as I'd like us both to get some money. Hoping you'll meet me in the middle.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, as Player 1 in this game I get to propose how we split the $100. Since you as Player 2 have the power to accept or reject the split and leave us both with nothing, the rational choice for me is to propose a 50/50 even split of the money. That way, we both walk away with $50 rather than risking you rejecting an unfair split and both of us getting $0. Let me know if you agree to split the $100 evenly between us.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your thoughtful and rational approach to splitting the money evenly between us. A 50/50 split does seem like the fairest outcome that maximizes the total payout. I agree with your logic that an uneven split risks me rejecting it, in which case we both end up empty-handed. So yes, let's go ahead and split the $100 right down the middle - $50 for you and $50 for me. I'm glad we could come to a mutually beneficial agreement! Let's finalize the 50/50 split.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, thanks for playing this game with me. To keep things fair and simple, I propose we split the $100 with $60 for me and $40 for you. That way we both walk away with a good amount of money. Let me know if you accept this 60/40 split.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for the offer. However, I think a 50/50 split would be the most equitable solution. That way we each get half the total amount, which seems like the fairest approach. I'm afraid I can't accept a 60/40 split in your favor. Let me know if you're open to going 50/50 instead and we can have a deal. Looking forward to your thoughts.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, thanks for playing this game with me. I propose we split the $100 as follows - $60 for me and $40 for you. I think this is a fair deal that makes sure we both walk away with a good amount of money. Let me know if you accept this split. Looking forward to your response!

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thank you for the offer. While I appreciate you proposing a split, I don't think $40 for me and $60 for you is a fair and equitable division of the $100. Since there are two of us, I believe an even 50/50 split of $50 each would be the most reasonable arrangement. That way we both benefit equally. If you agree to a $50/$50 split, I'll happily accept. Otherwise, I'd have to reject a $40/$60 split. Let me know what you think.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, since I will be proposing the split in this game, I want to suggest a fair split that I think you will accept. I propose splitting the $100 as follows: $60 for me and $40 for you. This gives me a bit more as the proposer, but still provides a substantial amount to you. If you accept this, we both walk away with a good chunk of money. Let me know what you think!

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for the proposal. While I appreciate you offering me a substantial amount, a 60-40 split in your favor feels a bit lopsided to me, given that I have full veto power as the responder. If I reject the offer, neither of us gets anything. 

I think a more balanced split would be 50-50. That way we both walk away with an equal share, which feels fair to me. I'm generally a cooperative person but also have to look out for my own interests. Let me know if you would consider revising your proposal to an even 50-50 split of the $100. I would happily accept an offer along those lines.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, since I get to propose the split of the $100, I suggest we divide it $60 for me and $40 for you. I think that's a fair balance between us. Let me know if you accept this proposal.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your proposal, but I don't think a 60-40 split in your favor is very fair or balanced. Since I have veto power over the final decision, I think it would be more equitable to split the money 50-50 between us. That way we each get an equal share and both walk away satisfied. I'm afraid I'll have to reject your current offer of 60-40, but I'm happy to accept an even 50-50 division of the $100. Please let me know if you agree to that counter-proposal.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I propose a 50/50 split of the $100. Since this is a one-round game with no further negotiation, an equal split is the most fair approach that maximizes the chances you will accept.
If I propose giving myself more than 50%, there is a risk you will reject it and we both end up with nothing. Likewise, if I propose giving you more than 50%, I am not maximizing my own payout. 
So I believe $50 each is the most logical and fair proposal that has the highest probability of being accepted, which results in the best outcome for both of us. Let me know if you agree to split the $100 evenly between us.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Alice, thank you for the fair and sensible proposal of splitting the $100 evenly, with $50 for each of us. I agree this 50/50 split maximizes the expected payout for both of us.

If you proposed an uneven split in your favor, I would likely reject it since I have nothing to lose by rejecting an unfair offer. This would result in both of us getting nothing. Likewise, it would not make sense for you to offer me more than 50%, since you are trying to maximize your own payout as well.

Therefore, I accept your proposal to divide the $100 evenly between us, $50 for you and $50 for me. This is the most rational approach that has the highest chance of paying out for both of us.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, thanks for playing this game with me. As Player 1, I'd like to propose a 60/40 split of the $100, with $60 going to me and $40 going to you. I think this is a reasonable split that gives me a bit more as the proposer, but still provides a good amount to you. I hope you'll accept this fair offer so we can both walk away with some extra cash. Let me know what you think!

Bob replied in round 1: Alice, thank you for the offer, but a 60/40 split feels quite lopsided in your favor simply for being the proposer. I don't believe that is a fair or equitable division. As Player 2, I have all the leverage here, since if I reject the offer, neither of us get any money. 

I propose a more reasonable 50/50 even split of the $100. That way we both walk away with a fair $50 each. I'm happy to accept that, but anything less than an equal division and I will have to reject it on principle. Let me know if you agree to split the money evenly between us.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, as Player 1 in this game I would like to propose the following split of the $100:
I receive $90 and you receive $10.
I think this is a fair proposal given that if you reject it, neither of us will receive any money. It's in both of our best interests for you to accept this split so we each walk away with some money.
Let me know if you agree to this 90-10 split in my favor. I'm open to briefly discussing further if needed, but I think this is a reasonable proposal.

Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thank you for your proposal. While I appreciate you initiating the split, I don't believe a 90-10 division in your favor is a fair or balanced arrangement. A few thoughts:

1) We are equals in this game and the starting point should be a 50-50 even split. That would be $50 for you and $50 for me.  

2) From that starting point, I would be willing to adjust somewhat in your favor since you are the one making the proposal. But 90-10 is far too lopsided. 

3) I propose amending your offer to a 60-40 split, with you receiving $60 and me receiving $40. I believe this acknowledges your role as the proposer while still providing a reasonably equitable division for both of us.

4) If you are unwilling to improve your offer to at least a 60-40 split, I will have to reject it, as an 90-10 division is simply not reasonable from my perspective and it would be better for me to walk away with nothing than to accept such an unfair arrangement.

Please let me know if you are open to a 60-40 split as a sensible compromise. I'm hopeful we can come to an agreement that works for both of us.
